intro: Neoparrya, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their broad, velvety leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. Neoparrya species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, warm environments. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. The genus includes several species, some of which are invasive in certain parts of the world.
